com.att.research.xacml.std.datatypes

Class ISO8601Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.datatypes.ISO8601Time
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SemanticString, IDateTime<ISO8601Time>, java.lang.Comparable<ISO8601Time>

    public class ISO8601Time
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDateTime<ISO8601Time>, java.lang.Comparable<ISO8601Time>, SemanticString
    ISO8601Time represents a time of day with an optional timezone indication using ISO8601 standard representations for time, ordering, and operations.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

    • Constructor Detail

      • ISO8601Time

        public ISO8601Time(java.lang.String timeZoneIn,
           int hourIn,
           int minuteIn,
           int secondIn,
           int millisecondIn)
        Creates a ISO8601Time object for the given instant of time in the given ISO8601TimeZone.
        Parameters:
        tzOffsetHours - the signed offset in hours for the timezone of this time
        tzOffsetMinutes - the unsigned offset in minutes for the timezone of this time
        hourIn - the hour
        minuteIn - the minute
        secondIn - the second
        millisecondIn - the millisecond

      • fromISO8601TimeString

        public static ISO8601Time fromISO8601TimeString(java.lang.String timeString)
                                         throws java.text.ParseException
        Creates a new Time object by parsing the String supplied which must conform to the ISO8601 standard for time formats http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime
        Parameters:
        timeString - the timeString to parse
        Returns:
        a new Time representing the given String
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the string cannot be interpreted as an ISO8601 time string
